TopicTitle: Checking fuel levels in flight does work.

Articles.Content: No matter what I do. If I'm in flight and I try to right click to check fuel levels in individual tanks. It brings up the part manager and shows that the drop down has in fact dropped down, but it doesn't actually show fuel levels.

Use the arrow beside the staging button to toggle display of all stage fuel/dV info vs. just the current stage. Also if you go into the resource manager you can see the fuel levels there - but only if youre not under thrust I think

I am also unable to see the fuel level for an individual tank via the part manager.
It is possible to see the level for a stage but not for individual tank level.
There is a bug when the save game is loaded the "Stage fuel level" display zero, you need to start the engine for a second  for the display to reset.
It also display zero for a stage that have never fired it's engine

Rasoubia
KSP Version: 0.1.0.0.20892
OS:        Windows 10 Home  Version:   21H2
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-9700 CPU @ 3.00GHz   3.00 GHz
RAM:       16.0 GB (15.8 GB usable)
Display:   NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070

27 minutes ago, Sea_Kerman said:

Not part manager, resource manager

Thanks, I was under the impression that resource manager was only for fuel transfer. But you are right it show all tank level.
With this info, for me, the issue is only with the staging section before firing the engine.
